sect1.title: Get the latest release: NetBSD &release.latest;
sect1.para: The latest formal release is NetBSD &release.latest;.

Formal releases provide a stable, supported platform for use in production systems. They are also the proper choice for starters and for everyone who wants to get to know NetBSD. Using a NetBSD-release branch is an easy way to get the most up to date fixes for the most recent release.

itemizedlist.listitem: Download a NetBSD &release.latest; port using BitTorrent (torrents via HTTP).
Download an ISO image to burn an install CD: Choose a mirror server from the list, change into the &release.latest; directory and fetch the ISO file for the needed port.
Download NetBSD &release.latest; via FTP or HTTP: Change into the NetBSD &release.latest; directory and fetch the files for the needed port.

sect1.para: For more information about NetBSD releases see:

sect1.title: NetBSD-current
sect1.para: NetBSD-current is the development version of NetBSD. Builds or snapshots of -current provide generally more features than formal releases, but have not had the same degree of testing, and should be avoided on production systems where possible. They are aimed at developers, experienced testers and early adopters. More information about getting and maintaining NetBSD-current.
